description_txt: stated on July 8, 2012 in a newspaper op-ed:
quote_txt: The health care law "adds around $800 billion of taxes on the American people. It does not discriminate between rich and poor."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2012 in a Web advertisement titled “College vs. Smokes.”:
quote_txt: "Bill O'Brien's Tea Party legislature tried to repeal kindergarten and compulsory education, defund Planned Parenthood and eliminate insurance coverage for birth control."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Foreign Chinese prostitution money is allegedly behind the groups funding Congressman Sean Duffy’s Republican Majority."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2012 in an appearance at the Brookings Institution:
quote_txt: "New Jersey today has fewer employees in state government than it had when Christie Whitman left office in January of 2001, and I think that’s good. And we did it without any layoffs. We did it through attrition."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: Because of the health care act, "The people who have health care and like it in this county are not going to be able to keep what they have."

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2012 in a telephone town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "The state of Ohio has one of the lowest unemployment rates in the nation right now and is leading the pack in terms of job creation."

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2012 in an article:
quote_txt: Funding the federal health care law without a tax hike will "require the state to cut nearly a quarter of its annual budget."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2012 in tweets:
quote_txt: Says he "never supported" federal health care individual mandate.

description_txt: stated on July 11, 2012 in an interview on WNYC’s The Brian Lehrer Show:
quote_txt: "We are not producing jobs. We created 80,000 jobs last month. We don't talk about the jobs that we lost. The net of it all is that we lost jobs."

description_txt: stated on July 11, 2012 in a question to a candidate:
quote_txt: President Obama’s health care law says "when you sell your house now you have to pay a 3.8 percent tax."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 15, 2012

description_txt: stated on July 12, 2012 in a Republican gubernatorial debate at Franklin Pierce University in Rindge, N.H.:
quote_txt: "There are 60,000 fewer jobs today in this state than we had in 2008."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2012 in a speech after he filed to run for reelection at the New Hampshire Statehouse:
quote_txt: "America used to be the third easiest country to get established in a business. It's now number 17."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2012 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "Mitt Romney's companies were pioneers in outsourcing U.S. jobs to low-wage countries."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2012 in news conference remarks:
quote_txt: Says she "stood up to" Gov. Scott Walker on tax cuts "for wealthy corporations" while her congressional opponent voted with Walker.

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2012 in a fundraising email:
quote_txt: Sherrod Brown’s approval rating "has plummeted to 38 percent among Ohio voters" in a poll by a Democratic pollster.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "83% of doctors have considered leaving the profession because of #Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on July 4, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "For his first interview as president, Barack Obama chose Arab TV for an apology."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: The United States can immediately tap a domestic energy resource of "more than 1.5 trillion barrels of oil, six times more than Saudi Arabia."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2012 in a speech at the Brookings Institution:
quote_txt: Says New Jersey’s tenure law "has now been reformed to say that if teachers get two years of partially effective or ineffective ratings they lose tenure."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Foreign Chinese prostitution money is allegedly behind the groups funding Congressman Jim Renacci’s Republican majority."

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: The health care law could cost up to $2 trillion, "double what we were promised."

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a public health campaign:
quote_txt: Says "Your kid just ate 16 packs of sugar."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: Says the federal government is spending $765,828 to subsidize "pancakes for yuppies" in Washington.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: The health care law "imposes the largest tax increase in history on the middle class."

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "Bill Nelson was the deciding vote" on the health care law.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2012 in a speech to the NAACP convention in Houston.:
quote_txt: Says recent studies indicate that nationally, only 8 percent of white voting-age citizens but 25 percent of African-American voting-age citizens lack government-issued photo IDs.

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: President Barack Obama’s health care reform "slashed $500 billion from Medicare."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in an interview on Richard French Live:
quote_txt: Says as a result of the national health care reform, "the Congressional Budget Office says we save $250 million over the first 10 years. Over the next 10 years, we save $1.2 trillion in savings in terms of health care."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: The health care law is "the largest tax [increase] in the history of our country"

description_txt: stated on June 3, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Cuts in local government and school funding in John Kasich’s budget caused "many communities to seek school levies, local tax increases, layoffs."
